channel.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
channel.description:
First of all, [10:27:22 PM] D3luxe: dont tell em your payin me with rsgp... He should be banned.
Now, I use to own a server, and i knew how to port forward, i did everything correctly but it still will not work, my friend gets the error_game_jsconnect error, I Have EVERYTHING right, But still nothing works, i can get in fine, but he or no one else can, Before i had this new router, it was easy, but now its impossible, the router is a Sagemcom F@st. And when i go to my router settings, its called Bell connection hub, My computer is a vista, but i dont think that matters since i had one working on this computer before the new modem. can someone please help me with this issue? it happens to all the servers i try to host, so its not me, its something with my router. Please help!!
PM Me or tell me your skype if you are willing to help!

item.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
item.dc:creator: @gimpie gimpie
item.description:
@gimpie wrote:

BUMP i need this to guys my modem is a telus V1000H and theres no portforward guide for it, however if i go to its panel in the browser i can portforward it, wich i have alredy done, i have also allowd the firewall connection and canyouseeme.org can see my connection, but yet asoon as i jar it and let my friend try it he gets stuck at 0% an it wont load. Can someone please help this is urgent i have teamviewer if you need it

Read full topic
item.source: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)

item.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
item.dc:creator: @IHitSpecs IHitSpecs
item.description:
@IHitSpecs wrote:

[quote=“LithiumAbstracts, post:8, topic:515740”][quote author=IHitSpecs link=topic=633998.msg4283255#msg4283255 date=1365996896]
Nothing Works, And no one can solve this or help me. I Give up.
[/quote]

have you tried adding port too firewall?
control panel > system and security > windows firewall > advanced settings > inbound rules > new rule (on the right hand side) > port > tcp or udp , specific local ports: 43594 > allow connection > and the rest keep default , hope that works :D[/quote]
I Use vista, can you tell me how to do it in vista?

Read full topic

IHitSpecs:

Nothing Works, And no one can solve this or help me. I Give up.

have you tried adding port too firewall?
control panel > system and security > windows firewall > advanced settings > inbound rules > new rule (on the right hand side) > port > tcp or udp , specific local ports: 43594 > allow connection > and the rest keep default , hope that works

item.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

go to portforward.com, search your router and it will tell you have to forward a port for in your routers configuration.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)

item.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
item.dc:creator: @IHitSpecs IHitSpecs
item.description:
@IHitSpecs wrote:

Brooklynn:

if you have set your port open for 43594 on your firewall settings you might wanna add it into your router too. go to cmd, type ipconfig and look for the ip that should start with 192.XXX.X.XXX

Add it how?

Read full topic
item.source: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)

item.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
item.dc:creator: @Brooklynn Brooklynn
item.description:

if you have set your port open for 43594 on your firewall settings you might wanna add it into your router too. go to cmd, type ipconfig and look for the ip that should start with 192.XXX.X.XXX

item.source: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)

item.title: Please help, I Cant get my 718 online. (Matrix 718)
item.dc:creator: @IHitSpecs IHitSpecs
item.description:
@IHitSpecs wrote:

Jmood:

It may be your firewall, you connect as a local entity so you don’t get stopped by either the router or firewall, make sure you have added an exception to your firewalls options to allow incoming and outgoing connections for port 43594 or the port for which the server is on.

Im pretty sure i did this, How would i do this though?
Also, im going to use this as a BUMP

Read full topic
